title: 114_s2253
content: The Act titled "Department of Veterans Affairs Veterans Education Relief and Restoration Act of 2015" restores entitlement to educational assistance and provides relief for veterans affected by closures of educational institutions. The "Department of Veterans Affairs Veterans Education Relief and Restoration Act of 2015" amends Section 3312 of title 38, United States Code to address the discontinuation of education due to the closure of educational institutions. Educational assistance payments are protected and not deducted from the individual's entitlement or counted against the aggregate period of educational assistance. The "Department of Veterans Affairs Veterans Education Relief and Restoration Act of 2015" protects educational assistance payments for individuals who had to discontinue their courses due to the permanent closure of an educational institution. The period for which educational assistance is not charged against entitlement shall not exceed a certain aggregate period. The Department of Veterans Affairs Veterans Education Relief and Restoration Act of 2015 ensures that educational assistance payments are protected for individuals affected by the closure of an educational institution. The aggregate period for which assistance is not charged against entitlement is specified, along with the extension of monthly stipends under certain conditions. The Department of Veterans Affairs Veterans Education Relief and Restoration Act of 2015 protects educational assistance payments for those impacted by school closures. It specifies the period for which assistance is not deducted from entitlement and extends monthly stipends under certain conditions. The Act includes provisions for the Secretary to continue paying allowances to eligible veterans and persons enrolled in specified courses. The Department of Veterans Affairs Veterans Education Relief and Restoration Act of 2015 safeguards educational assistance payments during school closures. It allows for the continuation of allowances for eligible individuals in specific courses during temporary school closures or after permanent closures for up to four weeks or until the end of the academic term, whichever comes first. The Department of Veterans Affairs Veterans Education Relief and Restoration Act of 2015 protects educational assistance payments during school closures. A conforming amendment is made to specify the description in the clause.
